results.content: A more structure approach on how to code in flask.  I.e. create all the folders, dependencies, prerequisite work, etc. before beginning. Create structured templates that we can user over and over again

results.content: I took Jorge's previous Flask course before and I'm impressed with the quality and improvements made with this new version. The pacing seemed just right, the videos weren't too long, and everything seemed much more streamlined. The only nitpicks I have are that some of the links shown in the video were wrong and I wish he explained some of the concepts more in depth, but other than that everything was great.
results.content_html: I took Jorge's previous Flask course before and I'm impressed with the quality and improvements made with this new version. The pacing seemed just right, the videos weren't too long, and everything seemed much more streamlined. The only nitpicks I have are that some of the links shown in the video were wrong and I wish he explained some of the concepts more in depth, but other than that everything was great.

results.content:
Enjoyed this course immensely,  especially the more concise format compared with previous courses by Jorge. This allowed for shorter videos, but without losing the depth of information he provided.

I have subscribed to an number of courses by this author, and I have enjoyed each.

looking forward to your next Jorge.

results.content: I am pretty young(14) and I found the course a little bit hard to understand because you went by quickly. I also would have liked to see how you did the comments form. In addition, I had quite a bit of errors throughout the course because you weren't being too clear on some manners. However that made me learn a lot. Thank you so much for this good course!

results.content:
I came to this course with very little knowledge of flask having built a tiny example app in another python course. I wanted to learn flask fully rather than an add-on for a python course. This had good reviews and one of my friends recommended Jorge's courses having done some of them.

I like Jorge's delivery and style however I find that this course is rushed and there is too much content for how little time he takes to deliver and explain it. He has a github site that he directs us too for nearly every video with swathes of code to copy and paste, I am constantly having to pause/rewind/replay the videos to keep up with his typing (which is done fast-forwarded in the videos) to be able to keep up with the code and explanations.

I feel that I will have to rewatch this whole course again to be understand the content.

This review sounde negative but all-in-all I like the course and he is teaching his professional style of working which, with a lot of practice, I should be able to implement in my own work.
